nodes.bodyText: Is ADDED the right event received for a replace operation?

When declaring inner classes it's' recommended that you make them static, else you'll be creating the class each time the parent class is instantiated.
Anyway, this file is already 400 lines long, why not move this class to a separate file to make things clearer and more readable?
Is this something forgotten? We're ignoring the returned object

The key object should be improved or replaced so that you don't have to iterate through the Map's entries and check if the key matches.
If your key had a proper equals/hashCode, you could simply get the value from the map watchEventListenerMapping.get(features)
Just create an extra object for the Key that encapsulates the AttributeSet and whatever other thing you're using to identify the object and implement the equals/hashCode methods.
